intro: Oeonia brauniana, commonly known as the Braun's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Oeonia brauniana is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators, particularly moths and beetles.
